raw: A number of times Nancy had been present at interviews which her father had had with noted detectives who desired his aid in solving perplexing mysteries, and those occasions stood out as red letter days for her.
expected: A number of times Nancy had been present at interviews which her father had had with noted detectives who desired his aid in solving perplexing mysteries, and those occasions stood out as red letter days for her.

raw: Isabel, who was the pride of the Topham family, was rather pretty in a vapid sort of way, but Nancy Drew thought that her face lacked character. She had acquired an artificial manner of speaking which was both irritating and amusing. It was her mother’s ambition that some day she marry into a wealthy family, and every opportunity was given her for a brilliant match.
expected: Isabel, who was the pride of the Topham family, was rather pretty in a vapid sort of way, but Nancy Drew thought that her face lacked character. She had acquired an artificial manner of speaking which was both irritating and amusing. It was her mothers ambition that some day she marry into a wealthy family, and every opportunity was given her for a brilliant match.

raw: “I have half a notion to take a different route back,” she told Judge Hartgrave, as she stepped into her blue roadster. “It’s a beautiful drive on the River Road. But the trip will take longer, and I am afraid it may rain.”
expected: <<I have half a notion to take a different route back,>> she told Judge Hartgrave, as she stepped into her blue roadster. <<Its a beautiful drive on the River Road. But the trip will take longer, and I am afraid it may rain.>>

raw: “I don’t want to take your raincoat,” Nancy protested. “What will you wear?”
expected: <<I dont want to take your raincoat,>> Nancy protested. <<What will you wear?>>

raw: Carson Drew nodded.
expected: Carson Drew nodded.

raw: “I saw her break the bowl and I was determined to see justice done. There is my name and address﻿—if you need it,” and Nancy handed the woman her card.
expected: <<I saw her break the bowl and I was determined to see justice done. There is my name and address--if you need it,>> and Nancy handed the woman her card.

raw: While Nancy Drew eagerly waited, scarcely daring to breathe naturally lest her presence be detected, Ada began to speak.
expected: While Nancy Drew eagerly waited, scarcely daring to breathe naturally lest her presence be detected, Ada began to speak.

raw: “How far do they live from here?” Nancy inquired.
expected: <<How far do they live from here?>> Nancy inquired.

raw: Nancy hesitated an instant, and then pushed open the door. As she stepped into the dreary living room, she saw the pitiful figure on the couch. Abigail Rowen lay huddled under a ragged old shawl, her withered face drawn with pain.
expected: Nancy hesitated an instant, and then pushed open the door. As she stepped into the dreary living room, she saw the pitiful figure on the couch. Abigail Rowen lay huddled under a ragged old shawl, her withered face drawn with pain.

raw: “In that case they would have destroyed it,” Nancy told herself. “Still, from the conversation I overheard in the park, I feel reasonably certain the notebook has never been found. No, if Josiah Crowley ever hid it in the clock, it must still be there, and it’s up to me to get hold of it!”
expected: <<In that case they would have destroyed it,>> Nancy told herself. <<Still, from the conversation I overheard in the park, I feel reasonably certain the notebook has never been found. No, if Josiah Crowley ever hid it in the clock, it must still be there, and its up to me to get hold of it!>>

raw: “Don’t be silly, mother,” Ada snapped. “You’ll only waste your money. We don’t want to go, anyway.”
expected: <<Dont be silly, mother,>> Ada snapped. <<Youll only waste your money. We dont want to go, anyway.>>

raw: Six girls loaded themselves into the launch and someone started the motor.
expected: Six girls loaded themselves into the launch and someone started the motor.

raw: “It’s too late to visit the bungalow tonight,” she decided regretfully. “I’d better get back to camp before this engine changes its mind again.”
expected: <<Its too late to visit the bungalow tonight,>> she decided regretfully. <<Id better get back to camp before this engine changes its mind again.>>

raw: “Well, I guess we have everything now,” the leader muttered at last.
expected: <<Well, I guess we have everything now,>> the leader muttered at last.

raw: And her father thought that she intended to remain at the camp for a week! He would not become alarmed over her absence until it was too late. Oh, if only she had never left her home in River Heights!
expected: And her father thought that she intended to remain at the camp for a week! He would not become alarmed over her absence until it was too late. Oh, if only she had never left her home in River Heights!

raw: Jeff still knew very well what was going on about him, but a certain alcoholic glitter in his eyes and his somewhat unsteady stance informed Nancy that he was not just as sober as the proverbial judge. She suspected that while he had been absent on his convivial celebration, the robbers had made off with the Topham furniture, for even in his condition of semi-inebriety Jeff seemed to realize that something was amiss. He stared at Nancy, then his eyes roved about the topsy-turvy room.
expected: Jeff still knew very well what was going on about him, but a certain alcoholic glitter in his eyes and his somewhat unsteady stance informed Nancy that he was not just as sober as the proverbial judge. She suspected that while he had been absent on his convivial celebration, the robbers had made off with the Topham furniture, for even in his condition of semi-inebriety Jeff seemed to realize that something was amiss. He stared at Nancy, then his eyes roved about the topsy-turvy room.

raw: “I don’t like to go in there, but there’s no other way,” she decided.
expected: <<I dont like to go in there, but theres no other way,>> she decided.

raw: Clutching the blanket and the clock tightly in her arms, Nancy Drew partly crawled and partly fell over objects as she struggled to get out of the truck before it was too late. She was afraid to think what would happen to her if the robbers discovered her in the van.
expected: Clutching the blanket and the clock tightly in her arms, Nancy Drew partly crawled and partly fell over objects as she struggled to get out of the truck before it was too late. She was afraid to think what would happen to her if the robbers discovered her in the van.

raw: After a vain attempt to remove the heavy cardboard face with her fingers, she lifted the automobile seat and found a small tool with which she could pry. It then required but an instant to remove the two hands of the clock and jerk off the face.
expected: After a vain attempt to remove the heavy cardboard face with her fingers, she lifted the automobile seat and found a small tool with which she could pry. It then required but an instant to remove the two hands of the clock and jerk off the face.

raw:
“Just the same you’ve earned one,” the marshal insisted. “If you’re shy about blowing your own horn, I’ll take it up with this 
Mrs.
 Topham myself.”
expected: <<Just the same youve earned one,>> the marshal insisted. <<If youre shy about blowing your own horn, Ill take it up with this Mrs. Topham myself.>>

raw: Locking the garage door, she went inside and switched on the electric light. The house seemed deserted, for Hannah, the maid, had already retired.
expected: Locking the garage door, she went inside and switched on the electric light. The house seemed deserted, for Hannah, the maid, had already retired.

raw: “Well, we put it over, eh, Nancy?”
expected: <<Well, we put it over, eh, Nancy?>>

raw: “Well, we’ll see what happens,” returned the lawyer.
expected: <<Well, well see what happens,>> returned the lawyer.

raw: “I never saw so many chickens in all my life,” Nancy declared.
expected: <<I never saw so many chickens in all my life,>> Nancy declared.
